N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 81.3 - Certification requirements

State Regulations
(a) Persons required to be certified. Every
scrap processor, and every scrap collector and repair shop which disposes of
vehicular scrap to a scrap processor is required to be certified by the
commissioner. (b) Application for
certification. An application for certification shall be filed with the

Division of Vehicle Safety Services of the Department of Motor Vehicles in

Albany. (c) Cancellation of
certification. Any person who is certified pursuant to this section shall
notify the department that he is no longer engaged in a business requiring
certification within 30 days of such fact. (d) A certified scrap processor, scrap
collector or repair shop may begin operation at a new location by giving the
commissioner 10 days' notice of the move prior to commencing work at the new
location. Nothing in this Part shall be construed as affecting a repair shop's
obligations under Part 82 of this Title. (e) A change in the name under which a
certified scrap processor, scrap collector or repair shop does business shall
be reported to the commissioner within 30 days. Nothing in this Part shall be
construed as affecting a repair shop's obligations under Part 82 of this

Title. (f) A scrap processor, scrap
collector or repair shop must post the current business certificate
conspicuously at the place of business. Notes
